intro: Elatostema obtusum var. obtusum, commonly known as the broad-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. The leaves are usually succulent and can store water, which helps the plant survive in humid environments.
